a) expresses that the transitive verbal situation involves an approaching movement or transportation b) expresses that the verbal situation involves a bringing to an end or a doing completely c) expresses that the verbal situation was carried out through a protracted period of time in the past.

portrays the verbal situation as something done with a design, to do with a special purpose, to mind that one does something, to especially go or come to a place in order to V, to go or come for the sake of V-ing
a) expresses that the verbal situation involves an approaching motion across a horizontal plane b) to come through time doing something, to have been doing something for a certain period.

a) expresses that the transitive verbal situation involves an approaching movement or transportation across a horizontal plane b) expresses that the transitive verbal situation took place for a protracted period of time in the past.

1) expresses that the transitive verbal situation involves a downward motion, or a putting or sending down 2) (in conjunction with the transitive process-oriented auxiliary verb -khäʔma 'to take along') to start doing something unfitting or unbecoming 3) converts an imperative like co:se 'eat it' into a polite and gentle imperative
